conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph and understand how slopes of tangents change over time.
The curve for Car A starts from v1 at t=0 and increases to v2 at t=t1. The curve for Car B starts from v2 at t=0 and decreases to v1 at t=t1.
For Car A, the slope of the tangent line decreases over time, indicating decreasing acceleration.
For Car B, the slope of the tangent line increases over time, indicating increasing acceleration.
Red lines represent tangents at different points on the curves.
For Car A, the slope of the tangents becomes less steep over time, confirming decreasing acceleration.
For Car B, the slope of the tangents becomes steeper over time, confirming increasing acceleration.
The magnitude of the acceleration of Car A gradually decreases, while the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B gradually increases.
